poem:
"Dividends of Dissatisfaction"

Shadows cast on the  
financier's brow –  
anointed by gold,  
heart stout and bold.

Doubling pounds as fears 
unfurl,  
the market's hymn ignites 
a whirl.  

In this grand theater,  
unchanged the score  
while outside - struggling hands  
ask for more.  

Overfed, the greedy maw,  
in deafening silence,  
devours the poor.
